metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9392 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
The calcstepsizes function in jpc_dec.c in JasPer before 1.900.17 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure) via a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9392` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjasper-runtime - 1.900.1-debian1-2.4ubuntu1.2
libjasper1 - 1.900.1-debian1-2.4ubuntu1.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: jasper package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.900.1-debian1-2.4ubuntu1.2').
